document.id: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Res.No. 217-03-23
document.heading: Resolution Number TMBC 217-03-23 of the Duly Elected and Certified Governing Body of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians

citations.citation: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Res.No. 217-03-23

recital.text: the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, hereinafter referred to as the Tribe, is an unincorporated Band acting under a revised Constitution and By-Laws approved by the Secretary of the Interior on June 16th, 1959 and amendments thereto approved; and

Article IX(a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws empowers the Tribal Council with the authority to represent the Band and to negotiate with Federal, State, and Local Governments and with private persons; and

Article IX(a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws requires a 30-day comment period prior to the adoption of any ordinances or amendments to the Tribal Code, whether proposed by resolution or otherwise. Adoption must occur through a roll call vote of the Tribal Council at a publicly held meeting; and
the Tribe is proposing revisions to Title 1, Criminal Procedure Code to provide for changes to complaints to add additional specificity; and
the Tribe, by Resolution No. TMBCI 07-02-23, approved a 30 day public comment period for proposed revisions to Title 1, Criminal Procedure Code, and no comments were made; now
that the Tribe is approving revisions to the Tribal code, Title 1, Criminal Procedure Code, as published in the comment period notice; and
that the Tribal Code will be codified accordingly, to insert amendments to the Tribal Code, Title 1.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned Tribal Secretary of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, do hereby certify that the Tribal Council is composed of nine (9) members of whom seven (7) constituting a quorum were present at a meeting duly called, convened and held on the 23rd day of March, 2023 that the foregoing resolution was adopted by affirmative vote of six (6) in favor - Representatives Elmer Davis Jr., Blaine "Slugger" Davis, Craig Lunday, Kenneth Malaterre, Ron Trottier Sr. and Chad Counts; two (2) absent- Representatives Lynn Gourneau and Jon Jon Keplin; none (0) opposed; with the Tribal Chairman not voting.
